description:
'''Rebecca Claire Hill''' (born 14 February 1994) is an English singer and songwriter. She rose to fame after appearing on the first series of ''[[The Voice UK]]'', auditioning with [[John Legend]]'s "[[Ordinary People (John Legend song)|Ordinary People]]". She joined [[Jessie J]]'s team and reached the semi-final of the competition.

In June 2014, she became the first (and only thus far) ''The Voice UK'' contestant to score a UK number one single when the song "[[Gecko (song)#Gecko (Overdrive)|Gecko (Overdrive)]]" with [[Oliver Heldens]] topped the [[UK Singles Chart]]. In 2022, she received two [[42nd Brit Awards|Brit Awards]] nominations, including [[Brit Award for British Single|British Song of the Year]] for "[[Remember (Becky Hill and David Guetta song)|Remember]]" with [[David Guetta]], and [[Brit Award for British Dance Act|Best Dance Act]], which she won two years in a row in 2022 and 2023.
